description: India successfully launched the historic Goods and Services Tax (GST) on July 1. While the corporates may have adapted to the new regime with a few hiccups, the agriculture sector has been grappling to come to terms with this transition. title: GST impact on agri: Traders, APMC market struggles with transition
title_page: GST impact on agri: Traders, APMC market struggles with transition - Moneycontrol.com
text:
India successfully launched the historic Goods and Services Tax (GST) on July 1. The landmark tax reform promises to boost government’s income, improve supply chain mechanism and improve transparency and reliability.
While the corporates may have adapted to the new regime with a few hiccups, the agriculture sector has been grappling to come to terms with this transition. Traders in Rajasthan and Gujarat have been protesting against GST.
In an interview to CNBC-TV18, Soumya Kanti Ghosh, Chief Economic Adviser at SBI spoke about whether GST will improve farmer’s income and will GST lift prices of agri commodities.
